page.title: 05OSBOURNBY VILLAGE.
page.content: A squat-towered ancient church links the old village with its square of fine vernacular houses to the more modern buildings along the A15 road. The newest is the County Primary School which serves all the local villages and has 80 pupils and education still linked to the country but with all the most up-to-date aids including computers.The village has a strong chapel as well as its church. There is a lively Womens Institute and a playgroup for under-fives.The new school is a centre for village groups to meet and can accommodate dances and other social events.A post office with general store,a newsagents and a butcher are the village shops.
